phaseBanner.text: This is a new service - your feedback (opens in new tab) will help us to improve it.

survey.text: What did you think of this service?

error404.title: Page not found
error404.checkAddress:
If you typed the web address, check it is correct.

If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.

If the web address is correct or you selected a link or button, this page may have been removed.

error500.title: Sorry, there is a problem with this service
error500.header: Sorry, there is a problem with this service
error500.tryAgain:
Refresh your screen or try again later.

We have not saved your answers. When the service is available you will have to start again

content.paragraph1: Your session has timed out due to inactivity.
content.paragraph2: We have not saved your answers. When you return to the service, you will have to start again.

content.paragraph1: Go back and check your entry.
content.paragraph2: If you typed the web address, check it is correct.
content.paragraph3: If the web address is correct or you selected a link or button, refresh your screen or try again later.

timeoutDialog.title: Your session is about to expire

Ask a question or get help in your language.

help@service.gov.uk (opens in new tab)

We aim to respond within 2 working days
contactUs.heading: If you need help completing this assessment

cookieBanner.title: Cookie banner
cookieBanner.heading: Tell us whether you accept cookies
cookieBanner.text: We use cookies to collect information about how you use '{{theService}}'. We use this information to measure how you use the website, so it can be updated and improved based on your needs.

allCookiesAccepted.title: Cookies accepted
allCookiesAccepted.text: You have accepted all cookies. You can change your cookie settings at any time.

info.title: Please enter the following information
info.info: Entering the information below will help us start to verify your identity. You may be asked additional questions as part of this process.

validationError.realDate: Date of birth must be a real date
validationError.futureDate: Date of birth must be be in the past

bankAccount.title: Answer these questions about your account
bankAccount.header: Answer these questions about your account

lastOpened.question: When did you last open a bank account?
lastOpened.questionHint: Tell us when you opened your personal 'current' account. This does not include joint accounts, business accounts or savings accounts.

validationError.required: When you last opened a bank account is required

cvv.question: What is the security code (sometimes known as the 'CVV') of the debit card connected to you current account?
cvv.questionHint: This is the 3-digit number you can find on the back of your card.

validationError.digits: The security code must be 3-digit number

mortgage.question: How much is left to pay on your mortgage?
mortgage.questionHint: If you have more than one mortgage, tell us about the one you opened most recently.

validationError.required: How much is left to pay on your mortgage is required

postcode.question: What is the postcode of the address where you were living in {{monthAndYear}}?

accessibilityStatement.title: Accessibility statement for '{{theService}}'
accessibilityStatement.paragraph1: This accessibility statement explains how accessible this service is, what to do if you have difficulty using it, and how to report accessibility problems with the service.
accessibilityStatement.paragraph2: This service is part of the wider GOV.UK website. There is a separate accessibility statement for the main GOV.UK website (opens in new tab).
accessibilityStatement.paragraph3: This page only contains information about the '{{theService}}', available at https://... (opens in new tab).

usingThisService.paragraph2: This service is run by Cabinet Office. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this service. This means you should be able to:

list1.item1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
list1.item2: zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
list1.item3: get from the start of the service to the end using just a keyboard
list1.item4: get from the start of the service to the end using speech recognition software
list1.item5: listen to the service using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)

usingThisService.paragraph4: We have also made the text in the service as simple as possible to understand.
usingThisService.paragraph5: AbilityNet (opens in new tab) has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.

howAccessibleIsThisService.paragraph1: This service is partially compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.1 AA standard (opens in new tab).
howAccessibleIsThisService.paragraph2: Some people may find parts of this service difficult to use:

difficultyWithSystem.header: What to do if you have difficulty using this service
difficultyWithSystem.paragraph1: You can contact the provider for extra support (opens in new tab) if you need help with filling in forms or getting a different format, like large print, audio recording or Braille.

reportingProblems.header: Reporting accessibility problems with this service
reportingProblems.paragraph1: We are always looking to improve the accessibility of this service. If you find any problems that are not listed on this page or think we are not meeting accessibility requirements, report the accessibility problem (opens in a new tab).

ifYouAreNotHappy.header: If you are not happy with our response
ifYouAreNotHappy.paragraph1: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the 'accessibility regulations'). If you are not happy with how we respond to your complaint, contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS) (opens in new tab) or the Equality Commission for Northern Ireland (ECNI) (opens in new tab) if you live in Northern Ireland.

contactingUs.header: Contacting us by phone or getting a visit from us in person
contactingUs.paragraph1: We provide a text relay service if you are deaf, hearing impaired or have a speech impediment.
contactingUs.paragraph2: We can provide a British Sign Language (BSL) interpreter, or you can arrange a visit from an advisor to help you complete the service.
contactingUs.paragraph3: Find out how to get extra support from the provider (opens in new tab).

technicalAboutServiceAccessibility.header: Technical information about this service’s accessibility
technicalAboutServiceAccessibility.paragraph1: Cabinet Office is committed to making this service accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
technicalAboutServiceAccessibility.paragraph2: This service is partially compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.1 AA standard (opens in new tab), due to the non-compliances listed below.

nonAccessibleContent.paragraph1: The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons.

howWeTested.paragraph1: The service was last tested on 11 December 2020 and was checked for compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA.
howWeTested.paragraph2: The service was built using parts that were tested by the Digital Accessibility Centre (opens in new tab). The full service was tested by HMRC and included disabled users.
howWeTested.paragraph3: This page was published on 11 December 2020. It was last updated on 11 December 2020.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy policy for '{{theService}}'
privacyPolicy.paragraph1: This notice sets out how we will use your personal data, and your rights. It is made under Articles 13 and/or 14 of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

purposeSection.paragraph1: The purposes for which we are processing your personal data are:

list.item2: issuance of Kent Access Permits (KAP) to qualifying declarations
list.item3: supporting users in the use of our service
list.item4: providing data to organisations and functions for their traffic flow, border management and law enforcement functions
list.item5: protecting the site and keeping your data secure

dataSection.paragraph1: We will process the following personal data: your email address, your IP address (to allow you to connect to the service), web analytics data (for service usage tracking and improvement purposes), and your name and email address when raising a support ticket.

legalSection.paragraph1: The legal basis for processing your personal data is that processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the data controller. In this case that is traffic management, border flow and border compliance readiness.

recipientsSection.paragraph2: Your personal data will be shared by us with HMRC who provide our service platform, and our IT supplier that provides hosting and web analytics services.
recipientsSection.paragraph3: We will also share data on Kent Access Permits with Kent Police, the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs, the Department for Transport and the Driver Vehicle and Standards Agency.

retentionSection.paragraph2: Data collected through cookies is retained by us for no more than 16 days.
retentionSection.paragraph3: Your personal data collected by us when you request support for the '{{theService}}' service is retained for as long as needed to provide support to you, and in any event, no longer than 18 months.

yourRights.paragraph1: You have the right to request information about how your personal data are processed, and to request a copy of that personal data.
yourRights.paragraph2: You have the right to request that any inaccuracies in your personal data are rectified without delay.
yourRights.paragraph3: You have the right to request that any incomplete personal data are completed, including by means of a supplementary statement.
yourRights.paragraph4: You may have the right to request that your personal data are erased if there is no longer a justification for them to be processed.
yourRights.paragraph5: You have the right in certain circumstances (for example, where accuracy is contested) to request that the processing of your personal data is restricted.
yourRights.paragraph6: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data.

internationalTransfers.paragraph1: Web analytics data may be transferred and stored securely outside the UK. Where that is the case it will be subject to equivalent legal protection through the use of Model Contract Clauses.

contactDetails.paragraph1: The data controller for your personal data is the Cabinet Office. The contact details for the data controller are: Cabinet Office, 70 Whitehall, London, SW1A 2AS, or 0207 276 1234, or publiccorrespondence@cabinetoffice.gov.uk (opens in new tab).
contactDetails.paragraph2: The contact details for the data controller’s Data Protection Officer are: Stephen Jones, Data Protection Officer, Cabinet Office, Room 405, 70 Whitehall, London, SW1A 2AS, or dpo@cabinetoffice.gov.uk (opens in new tab).
contactDetails.paragraph3: The Data Protection Officer provides independent advice and monitoring of Cabinet Office’s use of personal information.

complaints.paragraph1: If you consider that your personal data has been misused or mishandled, you may make a complaint to the Information Commissioner, who is an independent regulator. The Information Commissioner can be contacted at: Information Commissioner's Office, Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire, SK9 5AF, or 0303 123 1113, or casework@ico.org.uk (opens in new tab). Any complaint to the Information Commissioner is without prejudice to your right to seek redress through the courts.

termsAndConditions.title: Terms and conditions
termsAndConditions.paragraph1: This page and any pages it links to explains GOV.UK’s terms of use. You must agree to these to use GOV.UK.

whoWeAre.paragraph1: GOV.UK is managed by Government Digital Service (GDS) on behalf of the Crown. GDS is part of the Cabinet Office and will be referred to as ‘we’ from now on.

usingTheService.paragraph1: You agree to use GOV.UK only for lawful purposes. You must also use it in a way that does not infringe the rights of, or restrict or inhibit the use and enjoyment of, this site by anyone else.
usingTheService.paragraph2: We update GOV.UK all the time. We can change or remove content at any time without notice.

servicesAndTransactions.paragraph1: You can use GOV.UK to access online government services and transactions, for example GOV.UK Verify or register to vote.
servicesAndTransactions.paragraph2: These can be managed by <abbr title="Government Digital Service">GDS</abbr> or another government department or agency.
servicesAndTransactions.paragraph3: Some services have their own terms and conditions which also apply - read these before you use the service.

linkingTo.paragraph1: We welcome and encourage other websites to link to GOV.UK.
linkingTo.paragraph2: You must contact us for permission if you want to either:

list1.item1: charge your website’s users to click on a link to any page on GOV.UK
list1.item2: say your website is associated with or endorsed by GOV.UK or another government department or agency

linkingFrom.paragraph1: GOV.UK links to websites that are managed by other government departments and agencies, service providers or other organisations. We do not have any control over the content on these websites.

list1.item1: the protection of any information you give to these websites
list1.item2: any loss or damage that may come from your use of these websites, or any other websites they link to

linkingFrom.paragraph3: You agree to release us from any claims or disputes that may come from using these websites.
linkingFrom.paragraph4: You should read all terms and conditions, privacy policies and end user licences that relate to these websites before you use them.

usingContent.paragraph1: Most content on GOV.UK is subject to Crown copyright protection and is published under theOpen Government Licence (OGL).
usingContent.paragraph2: Some content is exempt from the OGL - check the list of exemptions.
usingContent.paragraph3: Departmental logos and crests are also exempt from the <abbr title="Open Government Licence">OGL</abbr>, except when they form an integral part of a document or dataset.
usingContent.paragraph4: If any content is not subject to Crown copyright protection or published under the <abbr title="Open Government Licence">OGL</abbr>, we’ll usually credit the author or copyright holder.
usingContent.paragraph5: You can reproduce content published on GOV.UK under the <abbr title="Open Government Licence">OGL</abbr> as long as you follow the licence’s conditions.
usingContent.paragraph6: Contact us if you want to reproduce a piece of content but are not sure if it’s covered by Crown copyright or the OGL.
usingContent.paragraph7: We make most of the content on GOV.UK available through feeds for other websites and applications to use. The websites and applications that use our feeds are not our products, and they might use versions of our content that have been edited and stored for later use (‘cached’).
usingContent.paragraph8: We do not give any guarantees, conditions or warranties about the accuracy or completeness of any content used by these products. We’re not liable for any loss or damage that may come from your use of these products.
usingContent.paragraph9: The most up to date version of our content will always be on GOV.UK.

disclaimer.paragraph1: While we make every effort to keep GOV.UK up to date, we do not provide any guarantees, conditions or warranties that the information will be:
disclaimer.paragraph2: We do not publish advice on GOV.UK. You should get professional or specialist advice before doing anything on the basis of the content.
disclaimer.paragraph3: We’re not liable for any loss or damage that may come from using GOV.UK. This includes:

list2.item1: any direct, indirect or consequential losses
list2.item2: any loss or damage caused by civil wrongs (‘tort’, including negligence), breach of contract or otherwise
list2.item3: the use of GOV.UK and any websites that are linked to or from it
list2.item4: the inability to use GOV.UK and any websites that are linked to or from it

disclaimer.paragraph4: This applies if the loss or damage was foreseeable, arose in the normal course of things or you advised us that it might happen.
disclaimer.paragraph5: This includes (but is not limited to) the loss of your:

list3.item10: intangible property, including loss, corruption or damage to data or any computer system

disclaimer.paragraph6: We may still be liable for:

list4.item1: death or personal injury arising from our negligence
list4.item3: any other liability which cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law

requestToRemoveContent.paragraph1: You can ask for content to be removed from GOV.UK. We’ll remove content:

list1.item1: in order to comply with data protection legislation covering the rights and freedoms of individuals
list1.item2: if it breaches copyright laws, contains sensitive personal data or material that may be considered obscene or defamatory

requestToRemoveContent.paragraph2: Contact usto ask for content to be removed. You’ll need to send us the web address (URL) of the content and explain why you think it should be removed. We’ll reply to let you know whether we’ll remove it.
requestToRemoveContent.paragraph3: We remove content at our discretion in discussion with the department or agency responsible for it. You can still request information under the Freedom of Information Act and the Data Protection Act.

informationAboutYou.header: Information about you and your visits to GOV.UK
informationAboutYou.paragraph1: We collect information about you in accordance with our privacy policy and our cookie policy. By using GOV.UK, you agree to us collecting this information and confirm that any data you provide is accurate.

virusProtection.paragraph1: We make every effort to check and test GOV.UK for viruses at every stage of production. You must make sure that the way you use GOV.UK does not expose you to the risk of viruses, malicious computer code or other forms of interference which can damage your computer system.
virusProtection.paragraph2: We’re not responsible for any loss, disruption or damage to your data or computer system that might happen when you use GOV.UK.

virusesAndHacking.paragraph1: When using GOV.UK, you must not introduce viruses, trojans, worms, logic bombs or any other material that’s malicious or technologically harmful.
virusesAndHacking.paragraph2: You must not try to gain unauthorised access to GOV.UK, the server on which it’s stored or any server, computer or database connected to it.
virusesAndHacking.paragraph3: You must not attack GOV.UK in any way. This includes denial-of-service attacks.
virusesAndHacking.paragraph4: We’ll report any attacks or attempts to gain unauthorised access to GOV.UK to the relevant law enforcement authorities and share information about you with them.

governingLaw.paragraph1: These terms and conditions are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales.
governingLaw.paragraph2: Any dispute you have which relates to these terms and conditions, or your use of GOV.UK (whether it be contractual or non-contractual), will be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales.

general.paragraph1: There may be legal notices elsewhere on GOV.UK that relate to how you use the site.
general.paragraph2: We’re not liable if we fail to comply with these terms and conditions because of circumstances beyond our reasonable control.
general.paragraph3: We might decide not to exercise or enforce any right available to us under these terms and conditions. We can always decide to exercise or enforce that right at a later date.
general.paragraph4: Doing this once will not mean we automatically waive the right on any other occasion.
general.paragraph5: If any of these terms and conditions are held to be invalid, unenforceable or illegal for any reason, the remaining terms and conditions will still apply.

changes.header: Changes to these terms and conditions
changes.paragraph1: Please check these terms and conditions regularly. We can update them at any time without notice.
changes.paragraph2: You’ll agree to any changes if you continue to use GOV.UK after the terms and conditions have been updated.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.paragraph1: '{{theService}}' puts small files (known as 'cookies') onto your computer to collect information about how you use the service.
cookies.list: deliver essential elements of the service|measure how you use it, so it can be updated and improved based on your needs|remember the notifications you have seen so that you are not shown them again
cookies.paragraph3: '{{theService}}' cookies are not used to identify you personally.
cookies.paragraph4: You will normally see a message on the site before a cookie is stored on your computer.
cookies.paragraph5: Find out more about how to manage cookies (opens in new tab)

saved.text: Government services may set additional cookies and, if so, will have their own cookie policy and banner.

analytics.text: Google Analytics sets the following cookies:
analytics.paragraph1: We use Google Analytics software to collect information about how you use '{{theService}}'. We do this to make sure the service is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements.
analytics.paragraph3: We do not allow Google to use or share out analytics data.
analytics.link: You can opt out of Google Analytics
analytics.question: Do you accept Google Analytic cookies?
analytics.list: the pages you visit on '{{theService}}'|how long you spend on each page|how you got to the service|what you click on while you are using the service

choice.yes: Yes, opt-in to Google Analytics cookies
choice.no: No, do not track my website usage

necessary.text: The cookies listed below are needed in order for you to be able to use the service. They include:

service_session.purpose: Saves information you have entered while using the service

private_beta_terms_seen.purpose: Set to remember whether you have been shown the terms of the Private Beta
